meta.scheme: National Scheme of Welfare of Fishermen

sections.title: Introduction
sections.body: A centrally sponsored scheme introduced in 1992 to provide financial assistance and support to small-scale fishermen for improving their livelihoods and well-being.[^11][^12]

sections.title: How the Scheme Works
sections.body:
- Provides aid for construction of houses, community halls (for recreation and work), and installation of tube wells for drinking water.
- Includes group accident insurance covering death, total permanent disability, and partial permanent disability.
- Implements a savings-cum-relief scheme offering financial support during lean fishing seasons.
- Funds are matched by Central and State Governments.[^13][^12][^14]

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria
sections.body:
- Full-time fishermen licensed or identified by their respective State/UT Governments, including marine and inland fishermen.
- Priority given to those below poverty line (BPL).
- Members of fishermen cooperatives or welfare societies.[^15][^16]

sections.title: How to Apply
sections.body:
- Apply at the nearest FISHCOPFED office or state fisheries department.
- Contributions collected and forwarded by cooperative societies.
- Required documents: Aadhaar, Voter ID, income certificate, fisherman registration.
- States implement the scheme and ensure fund allocation and oversight.[^12][^14]

sections.title: Important Points to Note
sections.body:
- Insurance premium partly subsidized by Central and State Governments.
- Aims to develop sustainable fishermen villages and improve welfare.
- Provides social security and financial stability to fishing communities.[^17][^18]
